website_summaries.verdict: People were generally receptive of the Mizuno Wave Shadow 2. They liked this neutral road shoe’s lightweight construction, the vibrant colorways, and the traction-ready outsole. On the other hand, the width was considered to be a bit inconsistent; while some felt that it was just right, others deemed it a bit tight.
pros: The upper unit offered a snug yet accommodating fit, several people noted
Most testers liked the color schemes of the Mizuno Wave Shadow 2
The price of this product was deemed affordable by most purchasers
Runners deemed the weight to be suitably light for long-term use
The traction capacity of the outsole was dependable, according to a handful of testers
cons: Some consumers felt that the forefoot section was a bit tight

customer_reviews.title: Fake shoes; Not original.
customer_reviews.text: I already have this pair and pretty satisfied with it. The new pair I have from Amazon is totally fake. It feels like a plastic sole.
customer_reviews.author: Regnant

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight runners
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure: Everyone has a preferred brand and Mizuno is mine. I've been trying other brands for the last two years because I wasn't enjoying the Mizuno's current offerings but these were a pleasant surprise. They are incredibly light, overall fit is perfect, and the price is great. The two is a bit rigid and designed for a mid-foot runner looking for speed. The shoes run small; I'd recommend going up 1/2 to a full size.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Pelt

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality, started falling apart after less than a dozen wears
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mizunos because the brand has a good rep. Not sure why now. These shoes, at least this design, are garbage. After I wore them twice I realized I couldn't wear them long distance, they compressed the balls of my feet and wore a bit on my heels. Also my feet get very hot in them, they don't breathe at all. Disappointing, but still usable for activities other than long distance running. After wearing them maybe a dozen times, mostly for just walking around, I realized that not only are the rubber toes separating from the cloth shoe, they're actually splitting down the middle. Ridiculous. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Nice look and feel
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the green pair and the blue pair for my twin boys. This review is strictly based on the look and feel of the shoes. If the shoes don’t hold up with use, I will revise this review, I will say that $110 seems a bit pricey (I see the orange pair is listed at $89, and that seems more reasonable).
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this model of shoe
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, but I usually like these shoes. The shoes is actually uncomfortable in the ball of my foot. I don’t recommend and I am returning , I have worn the shoes off an on over a week or so and they just don’t feel good. Avoid this model.
customer_reviews.author: S.O.

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel!
customer_reviews.text: I've had numerous Mizuno running shoes and I keep going back. The Wave Shadow 2's are lighter than a lot of them but maintains a very stable feel. They also broke in quicker than any of the others that I've had. Mizuno has given me another reason to keep coming back.
customer_reviews.author: Todd F.

customer_reviews.title: I very much like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I used them to replace my old Mizuno's and they were equally great. Good fit for my running style and plenty of support. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christo

customer_reviews.title: Well made and good value
customer_reviews.text: I love Mizuno shoes, they fit great and hold up. I wound up sending these back because I decided the color wasn’t what I wanted after all. But these are great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Bman in the Sunshine State

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: The Mizuno Shadow 2 fits well around the foot; great for hard terrain running.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Stillings

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Mizuno running shoes for years and I have always been very happy with them. However, I am very disappointed with this pair because the inside heel is wearing away. I bought this pair in April and I run 20-25 miles each week, which means I've only run approximately 550 miles on these shoes and they are already falling apart. Not sure yet if I'll try another Mizuno shoe or if I'll buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: H Kevin Opela

customer_reviews.title: Good substitute for the old Sayonara.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a reasonable replacement if you liked the Mizuno Wave Sayonara 3. (I never tried the 4.) It is just a bit snugger in the forefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Jeep Junior

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet in these new shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes 👌. Very comfortable but lean forward and that took time to get used to
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Birdzell

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Have been using Mizuno shoes for a couple years now. They were recommended for low arches, which I suffer from. I shop around until I find a cheap deal in my size. They perform well and hold up nicely. I try to get a new pair about every 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron R.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Runs 1 size small
customer_reviews.text: Mizuno makes great products. Used Mizuno Precision for many years. Sho always ran true to size. This model seems to run tight on upper ridge of foot. First time it’s happened with Mizuno. This shoe is great for those that loved the Mizuno Precision line. Same shoe different name
customer_reviews.author: Marcos lionel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I feel fairly certain these were either fakes or at least poorly made. I wanted to like these, since I'm a Chicago Bears fan and the colors really appealed to me. The support was terrible/nonexistent for a $100 running shoe. My feet hurt after trying them around the house for an hour. Returned quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Larrycow

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and cushioning!
customer_reviews.text: Feels great - nice cushioning. Love the fit and the laces have some stretch built in as well. Great supportive running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and solid performer. Great all around fitness shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Willy Hartford

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I typically run with Wave Rider and these were a great, lighter weight alternative
customer_reviews.author: Be Rad

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the shoe feel on my feet. Very comfortable and very durable shoe. I walk and jog five to six miles several times a week. This is my second pair of Mizuno shoes and am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Dal Porto

customer_reviews.title: Size must be right.
customer_reviews.text: Had to get one larger size but that size fits well and is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were as described and arrived sooner than expected
customer_reviews.author: Tim E

customer_reviews.title: Good pair of runners
customer_reviews.text: Got for husband he loves them. They are light and easy to run in.
customer_reviews.author: Lenice Jones

customer_reviews.title: Son love it
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for our son. He loved the shoes, they fit well and provided great support.
customer_reviews.author: melissa hummer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Used to wear ASICS to run but not anymore after finding these Mizunos. Just getting back into the running scene so still in the break in period but already feel better than any other running shoes I have ever owned and cost half as much. Big plus is a running shoe I’m not embarrassed to wear in public. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Davey Hall

customer_reviews.title: Light, yet strong pair of running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear Asics, but decided to try this brand after checking out reviews from runners. Very light and fits perfectly. I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: librarc

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe and super comfortable. It definitely is fits smaller by about 1/2 size. I had to return for a 10 when I normally wear a 9.5.
customer_reviews.author: Hakon Roose

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe - runs slightly smaller than other Mizunos
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace Mizuno Wave Syanara. They're great. Lighter and faster than the Wave Riders.
customer_reviews.author: AO

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not durable.
customer_reviews.text: The back inside heel has worn out in 3 months leaving the plastic exposed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Immediately started falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Usually a big fan of mizuno running shoes but these immediately started falling apart after 2 weeks of light use. Lost a big chunk out of the outsole.
customer_reviews.author: Zak Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe, but don't bother using it to run
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is great for wearing to work, out to dinner, or to the bar. This is not a real running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-range shoe w/ above average traction
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly. Running in them is comfortable and easy. These shoes offer good support for the average foot requiring arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Haight

customer_reviews.title: Light and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these particular Mizunos. I have been wearing Mizunos for about a decade and these have been one of the most comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for speedwork or even daily training
customer_reviews.text: Great for speedwork or even daily training. I highly recommend these dor mid-foot and forefoot strikers.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Same great mizuno quality as always!
customer_reviews.text: I can count on mizuno running shoes for consistent fit and performance, time in and time out
customer_reviews.author: Alex Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes - light, protective and nicely designed.
customer_reviews.text: Mizuno is the best running shoe I know. It protects my feet even after several years of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Elad Sterman-Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Loose forefoot
customer_reviews.text: Toe box not constructed well. Knit forefoot feels loose, ok for a kick around shoe not for running.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Stephenson

product_meta.title: Mizuno Men's Wave Shadow 2 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Light, smooth, and ready to move. A redesigned upper, softened step in feel, and snappy ride make Wave shadow 2 the perfect lightweight neutral trainer.
feature_bullets: MIZUNO WAVE: Wave sets the standard for running shoe technologies.
AP+ Midsole: Lightweight mid-sole material. Increased rebound and cushion durability while maintaining lightweight performance.
Solid Rubber Outsole for durability and speed.
INTERCOOL: Cool and dry. Offers great breathability. Ventilation system reduces heat and humidity build-up inside the shoe during performance.
